Fatal ventricular arrhythmias in COVID-19 appear to be directly linked to the degree of cardiac enzyme release, and therefore related to myocardial damage rather than arrhythmogenicity of the disease itself.
23 Therapies that produce QT prolongation have been associated with torsade de pointes.
24 Around 19% of new intensive care admissions would be expected to develop new onset atrial fibrillation,
25 but whilst arrhythmias do occur in 16% of patients, atrial fibrillation only makes up a proportion of this and is not a prominent feature in COVID-19.
26 This is remarkable given the haemodynamic and inflammatory stress that COVID-19 presents.
